result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J. Runnerstrom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert J. Runnerstrom is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert J. Runnerstrom was found guilty of Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:05 a.m. Defendant Robert J. Runnerstrom in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Robert J. Runnerstrom in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cm151, 15cm450. All parties in receipt of revocation packet. Burns - objects to references in revocation packet to threats to victim. Schiek/Burns/Defendant/Court statement on sentencing. 
Court Sentence
15cm450 
Jail -  9 months with Huber
Jail credit - 152 days

16cm151
Jail - 5 months with Huber consecutive to 15cm450

Any unpaid financial obligations are reduced to civil judgment.
Appeal rights given.
Adj. 10:30 a.m.
includes revocation summary and cover letter
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 19, 2017 at 10:00 am.
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

3:09 p.m. Defendant Robert J. Runnerstrom in court, in custody, with attorney John E Voorhees. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionniare & Waiver filed. Calling 15CM373,15CM450,16CF27,16CM151. Schiek speaks to agreement/resolution. State moves to dismiss Cts. 1, 2, 3, 5 in 15CM450. In 15CM373, State moves to dismiss Ct. 2. In 16CM151, State moves to dismss Cts. 1 & 3; State moves to dismiss 16CF27. Defendant's Exh. 1 (4/12/16 letter from Transitions Center LLC) marked, offered, received. Court grants State's motions to dismiss. Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1 in 15CM373, Ct. 4 in 15CM450, and Ct. 2 in 16CM151. Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Voorhees/Runnerstrom statement to sentencing. Schiek files Victim Impact Statement in 15CM450. Court statement. The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.

Court sentence - each Ct. 15CM450/16CM151
WHS
2 yrs. POP
Restitution $4,339.62/includes 10% - 16CM151
CC/CV/Supervision fees 
No consumption of alcohol/no tavern premises unless for work purposes
Continue therapy
DNA surcharge/1 Ct. only
DNA sample
Appeal Rights

15CM373
30 days jail w/Huber
17 days credit
CC/CV

Review hearing scheduled for August 15, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
If accepted as in-patient at Konoinia or other in-patient treatment facility - may be released for in-patient treatment.

2:28 p.m. Defendant Robert J. Runnerstrom in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Robert J. Runnerstrom in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 16cm151, 16cf27, 15cm373 and 15cm450. In 16cm151 -  Voorhees statement that defendant wants counsel - eligibility needs to be confirmed. Michael Schiek in courtroom for State of Wisconsin. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - Schiek/Voorhees/Defendant statement on bond. Court sets $7500 cash bond. Court enters not guilty pleas in 16cm151. 
Bail continued in all other cases. Adj. 2:41 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
